speaker: Secret Passage
lines: Books slide aside like people at a crowded bar making room for a fight they want to watch.
A stair curls down through stone squared by patient hands.
The air holds its breath and you agree to as well until it's over.
You brush cobwebs that are mostly string and two knots.
A peephole shows the common room from the point of view of the cat.
You hear the barkeep's voice without the bark on it.
A key hangs on a nail you would have missed if it didn't want you to find it.
The door ahead wears the smell of coin like cologne.

give_item.name: Backroom Key
give_item.description: Opens the door that isn't a door

choices.text: Go back before the key changes its mind.
